Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualisation
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.

Responsibilities


Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization


Your Profile


Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills; ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.


What We Offer


Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.


Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔎 Freelance Data Analyst | Brussels (50% Remote) | Start September | Long-Term Project 🔎

📍 Location: Brussels, Belgium (50% Remote)

🗓️ Start: September 2025

🧾 Contract: Freelance (PO of 5 years)

🌍 Languages: French, Dutch & English (trilingual preferred)

💼 Sector: Public Sector / Business Intelligence

We’re hiring a freelance Data Analyst for a major BI program with a long-term vision. You’ll work in a multilingual environment on strategic analytics initiatives that support operational and business decision-making.

🎯 Your Role

As a Data Analyst, you will:

Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and insights.
Build clear and maintainable data models to support business objectives.
Design impactful dashboards and reports using Power BI (or equivalent).
Collaborate on the setup of data governance practices and modeling standards.
Translate business needs into actionable data deliverables and visual stories.

Bonus points for experience with: Git, CI/CD, unit testing, or data mesh principles.

🛠️ Key Skills Required

Power BI or equivalent BI tools – 5+ years
Microsoft SQL Server / MS Fabric DWH – 5+ years
Advanced SQL & data modeling – 5+ years
Data governance and modeling frameworks – 5+ years

🤝 What We’re Looking For

Strong understanding of IT ecosystems and data-centric organizations
Excellent communication, storytelling, and stakeholder engagement skills
Able to work in a team with shared values: positivity, reliability, courage, and collaboration
Professionalism and commitment to long-term project success

💬 Languages

Trilingual: French, Dutch, and English preferred (written & spoken)

✅ Why This Project?

Long-term freelance opportunity (5-year PO)
50% remote flexibility
Stable, impactful public-sector mission
Multicultural, values-driven team

📩 Apply Now

Send your CV and availability ] or connect via LinkedIn.

Know someone perfect for this? Feel free to share!

#freelance #DataAnalyst #BI #PowerBI #SQL #BrusselsJobs #RemoteWork #BusinessIntelligence #PublicSector #Hiring

Title: Product Data Analyst Junior
Description:
Product Data Analyst Junior




Your mission

As a Product Data Analyst, you play a key role in structuring and ensuring the quality of product data at Facq. In the short term, you will actively contribute to our strategic migration project to SAP S/4HANA, ensuring data quality, consistency, and proper integration. In the medium term, you will help implement a PIM (Product Information Management) system in collaboration with IT, e-commerce, marketing, and product teams.

This position is a great opportunity for a recent graduate who is detail-oriented, structured, and comfortable with numbers and digital tools.




Your responsibilities

Collect, structure, and analyze data from supplier contracts, pricing grids, and sales history.
Identify inconsistencies, duplicates, and anomalies in existing databases.
Create dashboards and reports (Excel, Power BI) to support decision-making.
Work closely with business and IT teams to ensure a smooth SAP migration.
Participate in data validation tests (UAT) before go-live.
Document data governance rules and cleansing processes.
Contribute to the development of new Product Data Management processes with internal teams (IT, e-commerce, product & marketing).




Your profile

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, ideally in business, IT, supply chain, or equivalent.
Analytical mindset, structured and quality-oriented.
Excellent command of Excel.
Comfortable with digital tools and quick to learn (SAP, AS400, Copilot AI, etc.).
Accuracy, attention to detail, and error detection skills.
Fluent in French or Dutch, with professional English.




Why join Facq?

A strategic role at the heart of the company’s digital transformation.
A supportive and dynamic team.
A stimulating environment to learn and grow.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Graphic Packaging International, we produce the paper cup that held your coffee this morning, the basket that transported those bottles of craft beer you enjoyed last weekend, and the microwave tray that heated your gourmet meal last night. We’re one of the largest manufacturers of paperboard and paper-based packaging for some of the world’s most recognised brands of food, beverage, food service, household, personal care and pet products. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, we are collaborative, diverse, innovative individuals who create inspired packaging while giving back to our communities.




With over 25,000 employees working in more than 130 locations worldwide, we strive to be environmentally responsible in our industry and in the communities where we operate. We are committed to workplace diversity and offer compensation and benefits programs that are among the industry’s best to reward the talented people who make our company successful.

A World of Difference. Made Possible.




Job Purpose

As an Aurora Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting the Aurora program by coordinating the extraction, transformation, and migration of master and transactional data from legacy systems into Aurora Radius. You’ll work closely with local sites, external vendors, and internal teams to ensure data integrity and seamless integration. Your deep understanding of GPI’s business processes will be essential in translating operational needs into effective data solutions.




Are you passionate about data, systems integration, and making a real impact in business transformation? Join our dynamic team as an Aurora Data Analyst and help shape the future of our data landscape!




🔍 What You’ll Do

As part of the Aurora program, you’ll:

Coordinate data extraction and transformation from legacy systems.
Lead ETL processes and final data migration during go-live.
Collaborate with local sites, vendors, and internal teams to ensure accurate data loads into Aurora Radius.
Work hands-on with transactional data: Sales Orders, Purchase Orders, Inventory, WIP.
Travel to sites during rollout phases to support data conversion and cutover.
Ensure all processes are documented and audit-compliant.

📊 Your Impact

Deliver accurate, timely Power BI reports.
Improve data accessibility and quality across departments.
Automate manual reporting processes.
Ensure seamless integration of new data sources.

🧠 What You Bring

Advanced ETL and SQL skills.
Experience with relational databases and large datasets.
Knowledge of manufacturing and business processes.
Familiarity with Power Apps and Xlink tools.
Strong communication and problem-solving abilities.
Willingness to travel and support go-live activities on-site.

🤝 Who You Are

Self-motivated and reliable.
Quality and safety conscious.
Collaborative and eager to learn.
Excellent communicator with a strong work ethic.







What We Offer

Joining our team means becoming part of a forward-thinking organization where your skills and ideas truly matter. As an Aurora Data Analyst, you’ll enjoy:

✅ Competitive Compensation – A salary package that reflects your experience and impact.

✅ Growth Opportunities – Access to training, certifications, and career development within a global transformation program.

✅ Collaborative Culture – Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment.

✅ Travel & Exposure – Be part of a high-visibility project with opportunities to travel and engage directly with local sites.

✅ Work-Life Balance – Flexible working arrangements where possible, with recognition of your time and commitment during go-live phases.

✅ Cutting-Edge Tools – Work with modern technologies like Power BI, SQL, Power Apps, and Radius.







Ready to make a difference? Apply now and be part of a trans formative journey with the Aurora program!

Show more

Title: Junior Data & Analytics Analyst
Description:
Vacancy: Data Analyst Marketing & CRM

Are you a data-driven analyst ready to turn numbers into action? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to transform marketing and CRM data into clear, actionable insights 📊✨




Your responsibilities

Be the first point of contact for campaign analytics, reporting, and ad-hoc business questions.
Work hands-on with customer and transactional data (Databricks, Power BI, PySpark, SQL) and translate it into clear insights.
Collaborate with the Media Marketing team to deliver campaign reports and provide ad-hoc analysis support.
Support mature data products alongside data scientists (MLOps).
Identify opportunities to automate internal processes.
Ensure compliance with GDPR and data retention policies.
Communicate complex data in a way everyone can understand.




Your profile

Hands-on experience with data and analytical tools.
Knowledge of SQL, Power BI, PySpark, or Databricks is a plus.
Interest in marketing and CRM processes.
Strong analytical mindset, detail-oriented, and able to translate analyses into actionable recommendations.
Awareness of GDPR and data governance is a plus.




What we offer

A key role within a Data Valorisation Team.
The chance to contribute both operationally and strategically to data-driven marketing.
Collaboration with a dynamic team of data scientists, marketers, and partners.
A workplace where your analyses directly shape better campaigns and customer experiences 🚀

Title: Energy Data Analyst
Description:
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN THIS ROLE, PLEASE APPLY VIA OUR WEBSITE FOLLOWING THIS LINK : https://jobs.transportenvironment.org/o/energy-data-analyst




Your application won't be taking into consideration if you only apply via LinkedIn, thanks.










🫵Role: Energy Data Analyst

📍 Location: Brussels

📅 Application Deadline: 05/09/2025

✒️ Start Date: ASAP







Are you concerned by transport’s climate impact and continued reliance on fossil fuels? Have you got experience in how the electricity system will need to adapt to cope with the changes to both supply and additional demand? T&E is looking for a talented and dynamic data analyst to join the team to work on electro-sustainable aviation fuels (e-SAF). The electrification of transport and acceleration of the deployment of renewable energy will create both challenges and opportunities in the green transition. The analyst will work alongside the shipping and energy team to build a case for e-fuels to use in transport’s hard-to-abate sectors.




Aviation is a challenging sector to decarbonize. We’re looking for a data analyst to research available aviation decarbonization options, using data and research to inform policy and financial instruments in order to deliver the required fuels. We need convincing and compelling charts, analysis, reports and presentations to convert complex information into advocacy and media friendly material. Finally, we need to convince European lawmakers to set ambitious but achievable goals to drive the sector from being the fastest growing climate problem to one of sustainability.




This position requires an engineer or scientist with experience in environmental science, energy systems or related fields.







Main functions of the role:




● Taking a leading role on T&E’s analytical work on green energy for aviation

● Compiling robust and compelling data, evidence and argumentation in order to reduce aviation’s climate impact.

● Developing analytical models and tools, conducting market analysis, and quantifying the impact of regulations to inform policy solutions and T&E strategy

● Analyzing data as well as complex policy issues from a variety of sources including scientific studies, European Commission reports and models being used to shape EU policy

● Support the organization with ad hoc requests and fast technical responses for both internal and for third party stakeholders, such as policy makers and journalists.

● Advocating T&E’s position to policymakers at EU and national level, politicians, business leaders, civil society actors and our international network.

● Converting large data sets or complex policy implications into clear, robust and beautiful charts.










The successful candidate would ideally meet the following criteria:




● At least two years relevant experience in the field of energy and/or transport. This position is open to talented entry level candidates to those with 5+ years experience. Job title and salary will reflect previous experience.

Expertise in and knowledge of energy systems, electricity markets and synthetic fuels and their processes.

● Have strong analytical skills, an ability to quickly grasp technical issues, assess data, and good knowledge of Excel. Python programming would be an advantage.

● Relevant professional experience working on technical issues in the environmental or energy sectors, or in a research institution

● Project management experience including strong interpersonal and team-working skills and an ability to deliver to tight deadlines.

● Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to write in English fluently, accurately and concisely. Other European languages are considered a bonus

● The confidence to think and act with initiative, to engage and influence policymakers of different stripes, industry representatives and other stakeholders at the highest level.







Practicalities




This position is advertised as a permanent, full-time position based in Brussels. While we offer a flexible working environment, there is an expectation that there are at least two days per week spent in the office. Candidates can also be based in cities in our nearby national offices: Paris, London, or Berlin. For candidates based in those cities, there is an expectation that they will work in the T&E offices at least two days a week, and will spend several days per month in Brussels.




The salary package depends on location and experience. We are an equal opportunities employer and offer competitive salary and benefits.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons écht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten én collega’s en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.




🛠️ Wat je gaat doen:

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven écht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega’s uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.




🎯 Wat wij zoeken:

Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.




Extra punten als je ook …

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.




💡 Wat wij bieden:

Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, …
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt — wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden …




📩 Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?

Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje – ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

We horen graag van je!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst – Brussels (Hybrid)




Location: Brussels, Belgium – Hybrid

Start: ASAP

Type: Freelance




About the Role

A leading financial client is looking for a Data Analyst to help turn complex financial data into actionable insights. You’ll work within an internal team to build analytics models, improve reporting, and drive data-driven decision-making across the organisation.




This role blends technical expertise with training and knowledge sharing, you’ll deliver high-quality analysis while helping business users get the most from analytics tools.




Key Skills & Experience

Strong background in statistics and data analytics
Hands-on experience with R and / or Python for data modelling
Skilled in data visualisation with Tableau or Power BI
Experience reviewing code with a focus on clean coding principles
Experience in the financial sector is a plus
Knowledge of cloud infrastructure is a plus
Ability to train, support, and guide business users in analytics
Language: Fluent in French or Dutch, + English




Bonus: SAS, KYC

Senior Data Analyst – Brussels (Hybrid)


Location: Brussels, Belgium – Hybrid

Start: ASAP

Type: Freelance


About the Role

A leading financial client is looking for a Data Analyst to help turn complex financial data into actionable insights. You’ll work within an internal team to build analytics models, improve reporting, and drive data-driven decision-making across the organisation.


This role blends technical expertise with training and knowledge sharing, you’ll deliver high-quality analysis while helping business users get the most from analytics tools.


Key Skills & Experience

  • Strong background in statistics and data analytics
  • Hands-on experience with R and / or Python for data modelling
  • Skilled in data visualisation with Tableau or Power BI
  • Experience reviewing code with a focus on clean coding principles
  • Experience in the financial sector is a plus
  • Knowledge of cloud infrastructure is a plus
  • Ability to train, support, and guide business users in analytics
  • Language: Fluent in French or Dutch, + English


Bonus: SAS, KYC

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
HAYS IT is assisting one of their clients, a leading Belgian retailer with a strong presence in both physical and digital consumer markets, in their search for a freelance Data & Analytics Analyst. This role supports key departments such as CRM, Digital Marketing, and Promotions, and plays a central part in turning data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions. The candidate is expected to work full-time, with the office location in Zellik.




Must-Haves:

Master’s degree or equivalent experience (Economics, IT, Business, Psychology, etc.)
Minimum 3 years of experience in a data analytics role
Strong proficiency in SQL and Python; experience with Azure, Databricks, or Datalake technologies
Experience with reporting and dashboarding tools (e.g. Power BI)
Solid understanding of campaign analytics and customer segmentation
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and MLOps/DataOps principles
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
Structured mindset with strong planning and prioritization abilities
Fluent in Dutch or French, with professional English




This is a long-term freelance assignment starting mid-September and running until the end of the year, with the possibility of extension. The client offers a flexible hybrid working model.




If you are interested, you can always contact Sabrina, Hays IT via sabrina.vanpeer@hays.com or on +32 (0) 3 202 79 86.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
BettingJobs is currently working with a fast-growing iGaming company who are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team in Cyprus.




Responsibilities:

Support internal stakeholders with appropriate data analysis and help them making decisions
Translate business needs into data requirements and closely collaborate with data engineers to ensure the right data sets are in place
Build, improve or redesign dashboards that provide stakeholders with key insights
Follow best practices in terms of data manipulation and visualisation
Answer ad hoc questions and proactively identify opportunities to drive marketing strategies and insights
Maintain & improve existing dashboards & reports
Present findings in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical audiences
Consult and train end-users to ensure high adoption of developed reports
Continuously improve reporting processes and identify opportunities for automation or optimisation




Requirements:

University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
2+ years of experience working with in analytics and data
Hands-on experience with data visualisation tools (PowerBI preferably)
Hands-on experience with SQL (database interrogation, data manipulation)
Knowledge of cloud-based data storage and processing is a plus
Understanding of KPIs and performance drivers in online businesses (iGaming experience is a must)
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey clear and concise messages
Detail-oriented and focused on results
Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to influence decision-makers with data
High attention to detail, critical thinking and strong business acumen
Self-learning with a can-do attitude

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🎯 Vacature – Microsoft Data Consultant




Ben jij klaar om het verschil te maken met data?




Bij Beyond Data Group geloven we dat betere beslissingen leiden tot betere bedrijven. Data is voor ons geen einddoel, maar een middel om échte impact te maken. Daarom helpen we organisaties hun data te structureren, te begrijpen én te activeren — van ruwe brondata tot heldere inzichten. Met de juiste combinatie van technologie en mensen maken we data werkbaar, tastbaar en waardevol.




Over de Rol

Wil jij graag het volledige dataproces beheren — van A tot Z — en échte meerwaarde creëren?




Wat ga je doen

Je bouwt schaalbare dataplatformen op Azure (Data Lake, SQL DB, Synapse, Fabric).
Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert ETL-pijplijnen met o.a. Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python en SQL.
Je vertaalt businessbehoeften naar werkbare dataproducten.
Je zorgt voor monitoring, data quality en robuuste pipeline-performance.

Wat breng jij mee

Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in data-projecten.
Je bent vertrouwd met Microsoft-technologieën zoals Power BI, Databricks, Azure Data Factory of Microsoft Fabric.
Je denkt niet in tools, maar in oplossingen.
Je neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid en werkt vlot samen met zowel technische als business stakeholders.
Interesse in AI en hoe dit data-analyse kan versterken? Top — daar denken we graag samen over na.

Wat wij bieden

Projecten van A tot Z — van integratie en modellering tot visualisatie.
Klanten die jou zien als een échte partner.
Een hecht team waarin kennisdeling en samenwerking vanzelfsprekend zijn.
Ruimte om te groeien — technisch, inhoudelijk of richting coaching.
Mogelijkheden om je te verdiepen in actuele thema’s zoals AI, ....
Ruimte voor certificeringen en persoonlijke ontwikkeltrajecten.




Beyond Data Group is onderdeel van Select Advisory (met o.a. ARCH, Fly en Beople).

We geloven dat sterke data-oplossingen méér zijn dan technische implementaties — ze vertellen een verhaal: wie we zijn, waar we voor staan en hoe we kunnen bijdragen aan het succes van onze klanten.

Onze klanten? Van scale-ups tot grote organisaties die investeren in een datagedreven toekomst én openstaan voor innovatie.

Onze aanpak? Mensgericht, technisch onderbouwd en gefocust op duurzame meerwaarde — voor klant én collega.




📍 Je uitvalsbasis is Brussel, maar je kan ook werken vanuit Zaventem, Antwerpen of Luxemburg.




Klaar om mee te bouwen aan datagedreven oplossingen met impact?

👉 Neem contact op of kom eens kennismaken. We maken graag tijd voor een goed gesprek

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Our Reward Team helps clients navigate the total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions such as the EU Pay Transparency Directive. They bring together the right mix of expertise—covering everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and process.

Role Summary

As a Rewards Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our clients' rewards and compensation & benefits strategies. You will leverage your analytical skills and statistical expertise to provide insights and solutions that drive insights and decisions for our clients into the complex landscape of rewarding your people in a right, fair and effective way. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work with a multidisciplinary team and contribute to impactful projects that shape the future of reward.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct comprehensive reward & compensation analyses using advanced analytics, statistical methods and regression models.
Pivotal member of our pay equity & transparency team (see more information: Pay Transparency and Pay Equit )
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement reward, pay equity & transparency initiatives.
Utilise R and Python for data analysis and visualisation in BI technologies to support reward strategies.
Assist in the development of tailored reward programs that align with organisational goals.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations.
Support the implementation


Let’s Talk About You!


Strong interest to bring advanced analytics (and artificial intelligence) into our client solutions & applications.
At least 1 – 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics.
Experience in applying statistical techniques
Experience working with R or Python and Power BI (or other BI tools).
Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French).
Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and data visualisation tools.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically, innovate, provide high-impact solutions, and effectively manage projects to successful completion.


Our story

Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today’s digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.

Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.

Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)

In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.

Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.

Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.

Why work in GES?


Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.
People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.
Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.


Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:


My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities


Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality


Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.


Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: AI Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
We are hiring an AI Data & Insights Analyst.




What you will do

Analyse business needs and identify opportunities for AI-driven improvement
Collect, clean, and interpret data from multiple sources to support AI models
Build and validate analytical models (ML, NLP, predictive analytics) in collaboration with data scientists
Translate AI model results into actionable insights for business stakeholders
Ensure compliance with data governance, ethics, and explainability requirements
Support prototyping and proof-of-concept projects in Agile sprints




What you bring

3+ years in data analysis or analytics-focused AI roles
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and at least one ML framework (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)
Experience with data wrangling, feature engineering, and visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau)
Knowledge of AI ethics, explainable AI (XAI), and data governance principles
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Ability to communicate complex AI outputs in clear business language




Interested? Apply immediately!




myNEBIRU: Not into this role, but interested in what NEBIRU does? That’s totally fine.

Visit https://nebiru.be/mynebiru to see how we can support you - even outside our client missions. Let’s build the bridge to your next step, together.

Title: BI Analyst – Remote-First
Description:
🚀 Be part of a movement to change the way Europe pays

In today’s digital world, payments often still feel outdated: random delays and confusing rules make it harder than it should be to pay and get paid. The European Payments Initiative (EPI) is here to change all that, forever.

With Wero, our digital wallet, we make sending and receiving money simple, seamless and secure across France, Belgium and Germany, with more countries and omnichannel solutions coming soon. Supported by 14 major banks and the two largest European acquirers, EPI is building a new, proudly European payment system: easy, instant and transparent, all for the greater good.


🔎 What's in it for you

Join us as our next Business Intelligence Analyst, bridging Finance and Data to convert raw figures into actionable insights, owning the SQL + Python pipelines in Azure and Databricks that fuel our financial dashboards, billing engines, and senior management insights. You will work closely with finance analysts, business stakeholders, and other technical teams to deliver data-driven insights and make data-informed decisions.


🐝 About the team

You’ll join a team of 3 talented Data Analytics experts based in the Netherlands, within the Finance department. Each team member brings unique skills and perspectives, fostering a rich learning environment.


💻 Technology stack

SQL, Power BI, Azure Cloud, Python, Databricks


💥 Your impact

Build & enhance financial reporting: Design new dashboards, reports, and self-service datasets for P&L, cash-flow, and margin analysis
Maintain operational calculations: Own monthly billing, revenue-recognition, and commission-calculation pipelines. Implement automated data-quality checks and reconciliation controls
Data modeling & pipeline engineering: • Develop medallion-architecture tables in Databricks (bronze/silver/gold)
Stakeholder collaboration: Translate finance requirements into technical specs. Train finance analysts on new datasets and BI tools
Continuous improvement & governance: Champion cost-optimization and FinOps best practices in Cloud platforms
Work across several legal entities: harmonization of data models and reporting standards to present a single source of truth


🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

+3 years of hands-on experience writing advanced SQL, including window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and performance tuning
Proficiency in Python for data wrangling and automation
Practical experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex financial concepts into clear technical requirements
A proactive mindset with a strong bias for automation and thorough documentation
Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau

Nice to have:

Familiarity with dbt (data build tool)
Exposure to machine learning techniques for forecasting or anomaly detection
Understanding of financial analytics and reporting


🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

A first call with one of our recruiters
Possibly, a business case or a tech assessment
A technical interview with the hiring manager
A final interview with the Chief of Finance
Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse


⛔ Turn back if …


You don't have advanced experience with SQL and visualization tools
You cannot translate able to navigate from business to technical challenges




Otherwise apply!




🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities


EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Show more

  • Data modeling & pipeline engineering: • Develop medallion-architecture tables in Databricks (bronze/silver/gold)
  • Stakeholder collaboration: Translate finance requirements into technical specs. Train finance analysts on new datasets and BI tools
  • Continuous improvement & governance: Champion cost-optimization and FinOps best practices in Cloud platforms
  • Work across several legal entities: harmonization of data models and reporting standards to present a single source of truth


🕵🏻‍♀️ To succeed, you should meet at least 70% of these requirements

  • +3 years of hands-on experience writing advanced SQL, including window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and performance tuning
  • Proficiency in Python for data wrangling and automation
  • Practical experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex financial concepts into clear technical requirements
  • A proactive mindset with a strong bias for automation and thorough documentation
  • Comfortable working in agile, cross-functional teams
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with dbt (data build tool)
  • Exposure to machine learning techniques for forecasting or anomaly detection
  • Understanding of financial analytics and reporting


🪜 If this looks like you, the recruitment steps are:

  1. A first call with one of our recruiters
  2. Possibly, a business case or a tech assessment
  3. A technical interview with the hiring manager
  4. A final interview with the Chief of Finance
  5. Hopefully, an offer you can’t refuse


⛔ Turn back if …

  • You don't have advanced experience with SQL and visualization tools
  • You cannot translate able to navigate from business to technical challenges


Otherwise apply!


🫶 Our commitment to equal employment opportunities

EPI offers the same job opportunities to all, without distinction of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, social status, disability or age. EPI promotes the development of an inclusive work environment that mirrors the diversity of the clients our product is serving.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en écht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.




Wat ga je doen?

Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid




Wat mag je verwachten?

Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen




Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Energy
Description:
Freelance Data Analyst Energy

Hybrid Brussels, start asap, long term




Context

Our client is looking for a Data Advisor with an Agile Mindset Service

Side-by-side with other Contingent Workers and internal staff, you will play a part in building a sustainable, green and reliable energy infrastructure that stimulates economic growth and reduces our ecological footprint.




Service description

Our client is moving towards Data-centricity, i.e. Data becomes a masterpiece in its strategy execution, and a Data-driven company. Our mission consists in facilitating and driving the entire organisation to leverage data as an enabler to achieve its targets:

Creating business value through Data
Think Data intuitively
Unlock transversal Data fit for purpose

One key role of a Data Advisor is to close the gap between Business and Data. Together with subject matter experts, you define and design solid foundations for the Data in terms of Metadata, Responsibilities and Discoverability to leverage the Data Platform.

As part of a product team, you will move rocks to improve Data Management practices and to ease them.




What you will be doing

You contribute to improving the Data Governance methodology by providing feedback from the field.
You work with a Business Purpose, while breathing Data, Organisation & People, Processes, and Technology.
You understand and analyse the Business needs.
You are looking for solutions that can quickly bring benefits and keep an eye on more-long terms solutions to ensure sustainability on mid-terms.
You leverage advising and training (i.e. Data Owners, Data Stewards, Business and IT teams) by on-the-job coaching.
You continuously review and ensure transversality of the Business Glossary that defines the common and universal language within client, by formalising the Business definitions of data and their purpose.
You manage expectations from, and intensely collaborate and align with, multi-disciplinary stakeholders, departments and product teams.
You excel at bringing people with various backgrounds together to converge.
You are the ambassador of One Team for the Customer.
You always generate business value.




What you will NOT be doing

You shall not act from an Ivory Tower.
You shall not define Data Governance methodology but will influence its evolution by providing retrospective feedback from the field.
You don’t make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
You don’t manage the data community, nor engineering, nor development teams.
You don’t define the details of the solutions architecture, nor the technical architecture, nor will you implement technical solutions.
You don’t develop systems.




Requirements

You are able to speak, read and write fluently English and French or Dutch.




Technical Skills (required)

You can demonstrate proven experience with similar projects, missions or employments, with an experience of minimum 4 years with:

Data Governance – Mandatory
Data Quality Management – Mandatory
Metadata Management – Mandatory
Master Data Management – Mandatory
Data Classification, Data Privacy, Data Security, CIA Measures – Optional
Business Intelligence & Analytics – Optional
Big data – Optional
Data Modeling – Optional
Data Integration & API – Optional




If this sound like you, please send me your CV, day rate and availability to gregor@clearsource.eu

Show more

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:
Context

The Junior Investment Data Analyst is a member of the Investment Strategy Group (ISG) and works under supervision of the Chief Market Strategist for Indosuez Wealth Management (IWM). They oversee the data-warehouse rules and processes for the categorization of financial instruments (Bonds, Equities, Funds) within the Securities Master File (SMF) used by Indosuez Wealth Management Solutions (WMS), as well as the exposures tool within Private Banking.

Your position

Sustainable Finance Related Categories

As part of the Sustainable finance governance of IWM and in close cooperation with the Responsible Investment Competence Centre (RICC) and the DPAM Quant Team, he or she will oversee the process for the Sustainable finance related categories that are relevant for WMS. He or she will also oversee new projects, in particular the design the Funds Data Hub, the next generation fund transparency tool, that is being developed in close cooperation with IWM Third-Party Funds team.

BE specific: MiFID related categories:

Being part of the ISG and as analysts who understand the nature of financial instruments, he or she oversees the rules governing the input at creation of certain MiFID related categories in the dedicated individual fields of the bank’s Securities Master File (SMF).

IWM Exposures Tool

He or she oversees the tool detailing the exposure of Private Banking to Financial Instruments Exposure (Equities, Bonds, Funds). The tool details exposure by Country, type of Mandate, number of clients… The tool regroups financial instruments to show exposure by issuer, credit rating, region, sector…

Key Member Of The Investment Strategy Group (ISG)


As part of his activities, the Junior Investment Data Analyst:
Implements data quality rules under the supervision of the Chief Data Office (CDO)
Participates to Sustainable Finance related workgroups and
Together with Chief Sustainability Officer, Chief Market Strategist and relevant compliance officers, further develop WMS Exclusion, ESG and Impact methodologies
Together with the relevant project teams, participates to the continuous optimization of workflows
Follows-up on questions from the second line (Compliance Monitoring Process or CMP) or the third line (Audit)


Your profile


Bachelor or master’s in Business Management, Finance or any related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to assimilate a large amount of information
A critical and synthetic mind, demonstrated proactive mindset
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, Dutch and/or French
Team player and the ability to communicate easily
Flexible and autonomous in the way of working
Knowledge or first experience working with visualization tools, ideally PowerBI or SQL, Python being a great asset


Our offer

For more than 150 years, Degroof Petercam has been a reference investment house. Entrepreneurship is our DNA, expertise is our fuel. You will become part of a company with highly skilled, talented and passionate experts that aim for nothing less than excellence. The impact of our work goes beyond profit by looking at business from a broader perspective, challenging those who want to intellectually. As a part of Indosuez Wealth Management and Crédit Agricole, we offer our people ongoing learning and development and mobility on an international scale.

In addition to our fascinating work environment, we also offer:


A broad offer of learning & development programs including a Degroof Petercam Academy for both professional and personal goals.
An attractive and market conform compensation package
Flexible working hours & teleworking
An Employee Social Engagement Program
Access to the same Private Banking Expertise as our clients
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - no Experience Required
Description:
For thousands of years, MAPS have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a MAPS Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

Your responsabilities


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct.
You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately, resulting in better user experiences.
With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office.
The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge, a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Job requirements


Must be living in Belgium for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, MAP applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.


Ideal candidate:


Fluent in English and Dutch
Excellent research skills
Excellent local knowledge of your home country
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Belgium
Analytical mindset


Benefits


Work up to 20 hours per week
Earn a competitive rate of pay
Develop your research skills
Avoid the long commute
Work from the comfort of your home office
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours


Apply online today!

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant




Permanent contract




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You’ll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.







Check out some of our ongoing projects:

Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if they match your profile!







Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:

Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.







Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English.




Your technical experience

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.










Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities.
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification.
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid ways of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels.
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances…
Read more about the benefits we offer here.




Apply now

We can't wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Show more

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Vacature: Data Analist (Freelance)




Wij zoeken een ervaren Data Analist voor een uitdagende opdracht binnen een organisatie met een sterke maatschappelijke impact. Het team waarin je terechtkomt is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van rapporten en dashboards waarmee het management en diverse teams inzichten verkrijgen om prestaties te monitoren en problemen vroegtijdig te signaleren. Daarnaast lever je data aan voor strategische beslissingen en ondersteun je AI-initiatieven door relevante datasets beschikbaar te stellen.




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van interactieve dashboards en rapportages.
Analyseren van complexe datasets om trends en inzichten te ontdekken.
Aanspreekpunt zijn voor de business binnen een functioneel domein.
Coördineren van werkzaamheden binnen een team van ±5 personen.
Vertalen van business requirements naar technische analyses en documentatie.
Ondersteunen van strategische besluitvorming door middel van datagedreven advies.
Samenwerken met agile teams en bijdragen aan sprintplanning, story refinement en backlogbeheer.




Gevraagd profiel




Essentieel:

Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Sterke kennis van SQL (zelfstandig queries schrijven).
Ervaring met het opstellen van dashboards en rapportages (bijvoorbeeld met MicroStrategy, OBI of vergelijkbare BI-tools).
Begrip van data-analyse-architecturen (ETL, data warehouses, event-driven systemen).
Ervaring met data modelleren (3NF, data vault, dimensioneel).
Kennis van Agile en Scrum (story point estimatie, backlog, refinement).
Ervaring met Jira en Confluence.
Analytisch sterk, probleemoplossend vermogen en goede communicatieskills.
Vloeiend in Nederlands, met een goede beheersing van Engels.




Gewenst:

Ervaring met unstructured data en grote datavolumes.
Kennis van data virtualisatietools en event-driven architectuur.
Basiskennis van Python (code kunnen lezen).
Ervaring met SAS (Enterprise Guide), Kafka en Apache NiFi.
Kennis van ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.
Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een agile team.
Inzicht in trends en evoluties binnen data-analyse.




Pluspunten:

Kennis van de arbeidsmarktcontext is een troef.
Ervaring in een adviserende rol naar management en stakeholders.
Hands-on ervaring met AI-initiatieven en data-ondersteuning.




Wat bieden wij?

Een langdurig freelance project met maatschappelijke impact.
Samenwerking met een professioneel, multidisciplinair team.
Een omgeving waarin innovatie en data centraal staan.
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken (deels onsite, deels remote).




Interesse?

Stuur je CV en een korte motivatie. We nemen snel contact met je op.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Being an Avertimer means that you will act as a trusted partner to help our customers successfully achieve their transformation programs.




How? By translating their strategy into actionable projects and enable Business, Technology and Management alignment through Avertim’s three key service lines: increase performance, drive innovation and leverage compliance.







Your Job




As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support one of our major clients in the context of various Business Intelligence initiatives. Your role will be to:

Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques to generate insights and support data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain sustainable, understandable, and usable data models.
Present insights clearly through data visualization and storytelling techniques.
Set up data modeling governance, including related processes and procedures.




As an Avertimer, you will get the opportunity to:




Develop yourself in a place where individuals and ideas matter.
Engage in a career path providing you with the ability to continuously enhance your skills and knowledge.
Immerse yourself into a vibrant, fast-growing team and nurturing work environment.
Be part of an experienced international community of Avertimers and enjoy a network of cross-industry expertise.
Keep on learning from your peers and develop your skills.




Your Background




You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand and translate business needs into functional requirements.
You have proven experience in functional analysis, requirements gathering, process modeling, or solution design.
You are comfortable acting as a bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams.
You are structured, detail-oriented, and focused on delivering value.
You have at least 3 years of experience in a similar role, either in consulting or within an organization.
Power BI or equivalent visualization tools
MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric DWH
SQL for data modeling purposes
Governance and process setup for data modeling




Nice to Have




You are familiar with modeling and documentation tools (UML, BPMN, Visio, Sparx, ARIS…).
You have knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Prince2, PMI…) and related tools (Jira, Confluence, Bizagi…).
You have an interest in or experience with the energy, transport, or public services sectors.
You are passionate about digital transformation, process optimization, and business innovation.







About us




Avertim is a uniquely positioned Management Consulting Group that bridges the gap between Strategy and Operations. Our mission is to translate the strategy of our clients into actionable projects and enable the alignment between Business, Technology and Management.




Founded in 2007, and headquartered on Brussels’ famous Louise Avenue, Avertim has grown into a European consultancy group with more than 350 consultants and offices in Belgium, France, Germany, and the Netherlands.




To accelerate the growth of our consulting activities in the Belgian market, we are currently looking for Senior Consultants able to support the development of Avertim’s consulting activities in the Energy & Transport sector.




We take pride in holding the EcoVadis Platinium certification, a testament to our commitment to sustainable and ethical business practices. This commitment extends to every individual within our organization, and we encourage all our stakeholders to contribute to our collective efforts behind our 3 causes: health, education and environment







Our offer




Besides our vibrant work environment, we offer a competitive compensation package including:




13th month +double holiday allowance
20 + 9 days of paid holidays + possibility to buy 5 additional days via the cafetarian plan
Company car or green mobility package
Full hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package
Individual & Collective bonus plan
Laptop
Unique training, certification & learning opportunities
Meal vouchers & Eco-cheques
Cafetaria plan
And much more!




Have a look at our Life Page to get to know us more!







At Avertim, we value talent and mindset. No difference will be made during the recruitment process and applicants will receive consideration for employment whatever their gender, marital status, religion, age, color, sexual orientation, nationality or disability, …




For more information, visit Avertim's official website.

Title: Energy Business & Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




Phinest is a Belgian Management Consulting firm providing tailor-made services for Bel20 and Bel20-like companies.




We are a human-sized organisation working with a broad portfolio of clients in various sectors (Utilities, Pharmaceutical, Banking & Insurance, Retail, Transport, Public, Telecom).

Based on a holistic approach, our objective is to implement our client's strategic Projects and Programs and to ensure their business efficiency.




We strive for excellence through 6 essential Values: Quality, Cohesion, Honesty, Balance, Respect, and Openness.




Our mission is to create a unique experience where the most talented people and strategic projects magnify together. We are a human-centered organisation that believes in our people.




Position: Energy Business & Data Analyst




Your Mission:

Join a team at the forefront of the energy transition! As an Energy Business & Data Analyst, you will be the key link between business and IT teams, driving the design, development, and optimization of an innovative Energy Management System (EMS).




Your Responsibilities:

Analyze business needs related to energy management and optimization.
Translate these needs into clear functional specifications for technical teams.
Collect, structure, and analyze energy data to identify performance drivers.
Collaborate with stakeholders (business, IT, engineering, data) to ensure project success.
Monitor performance indicators and propose continuous improvements.




Your Profile:

A unique mix of business insight and data/IT mindset.
Knowledge in the energy sector
Comfortable with data analysis, modeling, and reporting tools.
Strong ability to bridge technical and non-technical discussions.
Curious, collaborative, and eager to contribute to the energy transition.




What we offer:




Our focus is to develop a long-term collaboration with our talented consultants. Therefore we invest in our people as of day one to support them into a blossoming career within Phinest.

Our Talent Management Services department (a.k.a TMS) is designed and fully dedicated to the development and well-being of our employees.




We also offer:




A company culture focused on well-being
A wide range of trainings and career development opportunities (certification, practical training)
A collaborative, dynamic and fulfilling working atmosphere with a supportive and collaborative team
The opportunity to work with a fast-growing firm and talented people
A competitive remuneration package with fringe benefits
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Data Strategist

About Remobi:

We are Remobi – we empower businesses to scale, innovate, and achieve their goals through high-performing, REMOTE nearshore technology teams.

Join our community to access meaningful freelance projects and help shape how companies operate.




Position Overview:

Location: Fully Remote

Role Type: Freelance/B2B/Contract

Duration: Long term engagement




Position Summary:

We're seeking a Data Strategist to drive rollout governance, interface management, and organizational standardization across departments and brands. You’ll support strategic planning, coordinate cross-functional programs, and turn departmental needs into actionable IT roadmaps.




Responsibilities:

Define/manage cross-functional interfaces and rollout processes
Coordinate rollout strategy, tracking, and governance
Align IT and business goals; consolidate departmental needs
Lead workshops, project meetings, and stakeholder collaboration
Support strategic planning, resource allocation, and roadmap development




Qualifications:

Experience in data strategy, rollout management, or enterprise IT consulting
Strong understanding of interface dependencies, governance, and change processes
Excellent stakeholder coordination and communication skills
Proven ability to translate business needs into IT plans




If this sounds like a match or you know someone suitable, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ❤️

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future 💰

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Analyze large, complex datasets (on-chain and off-chain) to derive strategic and product insights
Develop models and dashboards to monitor validator performance, user behavior, and protocol performance
Investigate network economics, user incentives, and staking flows to support growth strategies, research new revenue opportunities
Conduct exploratory and root-cause analysis of ecosystem or performance changes
Build data tools and reporting frameworks to scale internal decision-making
Present insights and data stories clearly to technical and non-technical audiences


You have


5+ years of experience in data analysis, strategy, or research roles in tech, fintech, or crypto
Proficiency in advanced SQL and Python (must be comfortable working with large, complex datasets)
Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills – ability to work from ambiguous problem statements to clear recommendations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
Experience with data visualization tools like Superset, Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field


Nice to have


Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, Airflow etc.


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! 🌟


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.
