Job Description

We are moving towards an increasingly data-driven world, with boundless possibilities. At Telenet, Data & analytics are recognized as the fuel & engine under the hood that can improve everything in our business. Within the Data Acceleration Tribe - the centralized data & analytics team in Telenet’s agile at-scale organization - our Data Strategists play a key role in shaping and executing our AI products.

Our Data Strategists are centralized and report into our Analytics & AI team. They play a key role in our so-called ‘Boost’ concept, with each individual data strategist leading the execution of one of our AI products and steering the day to day efforts of our data scientists and analysts to do so. This happens in close collaboration with business teams across Telenet (quarterly click-in mechanism with business teams) on topics such as Customer Experience transformation, Segment-of-one marketing, Value-based network roll-out, and Strategic workforce intelligence.

As a group, data strategists collaborate closely with our organization’s business - and data leadership to ensure that the work we do in data delivers value.

Your Key Roles & Responsibilities

  • You drive the execution of AI products to turn our data strategy into reality in close collaboration with business stakeholders, taking a leading role towards your fellow data colleagues in the topic
  • You provide direction by bringing clarity on WHAT the team needs to deliver and WHY this has to happen in specific macro use cases
  • You support topic identification and prioritization of use cases, i.e. you work closely with business leaders to identify and prioritize problems that can be solved through data & analytics
  • You proactively drive prioritization, ensure alignment and manage expectations with all involved stakeholders, including business stakeholder and data leadership
  • You proactively support, challenge, and inspire business teams by broadening their perspective and showing the possibilities that exist in the world of data
  • You make sure that we invest our data resources wisely and to the greatest benefit of Telenet

Your profile

  • You have strong business and leadership skills
  • A sharp understanding of how data can be used to drive the business.
  • Strong storyteller skills and the ability to deliver a message with impact.
  • Excellent negotiating and influencing skills to deal with conflicting priorities and ambiguity.
  • Ability to lead a group of your data colleagues (2-4) on a day to day basis to collaborate with business teams in delivering value from data
  • A strong background management consulting is a (big) plus, with valued skillset incl. slide writing, business cases, prioritization, project management, stakeholder management, written communication and presentation skills (pyramid principle)
  • You have a can-do mentality, an agile mindset and experience with dealing with change in an organization.
  • You speak English and Dutch fluently.
  • You have a Master or equal by experience, and 5-10 years relevant experience.

How we make a difference for you!

Start a new adventure in the beating heart of our data driven organization, where we work in the utmost flexible way, be it from home or from our open and trendy collaboration spots at the office, and collegiality is more than just a word. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We’ll coach you, train you and make you part of our story. Moreover, you’ll enjoy a wages and benefits package that will get you places. We’re talking meal vouchers, group and health insurance, a yearly bonus and discounts on Telenet products. Come experience it for yourself, our passion is contagious.

Title: Business & Data Analyst Healthcare
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

HR Rail zoekt nieuwe collega's, Wil jij onze teams versterken? Ontdek de vacature hieronder en solliciteer.

Opmerking

Bedankt om te solliciteren via deze link.

Wat is jouw rol bij HR Rail?

Het team Project & IT Management (PIT) van de KGV is op zoek naar een Business & Data Analyst Healthcare om het team te versterken. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de implementatie en het beheer van diverse projecten op het gebied van digitalisering van de geneeskundige verzorging.


Als Business & Data Analist Healthcare werk je mee aan de digitalisering van de sector geneeskundige verzorging door deel te nemen aan verschillende werkgroepen en commissies. Je stelt business requirements op voor de IT-afdeling en analyseert de impact en behoeften voor de back-office.
Je houdt toezicht op tests die worden uitgevoerd met softwarepakketten van prestatieverleners.
Je identificeert en test de door IT voorgestelde oplossingen en aanpassingen en stelt na akkoord het programma in productie. Nadien verzorg je de follow-up.
Je volgt voortdurend de ontwikkeling op het gebied van regelgeving op die binnen de KGV geïmplementeerd moet worden en je analyseert de impact van deze wijzigingen in regelgeving op lopende projecten.
Je beheert individueel een breed scala aan projecten en bent specialist in je domein in samenwerking met de expert en coördinator van het team.
Je analyseert vragen en problemen , zoekt antwoorden en identificeert het onderliggend probleem met het oog op het implementeren van een oplossing op korte, middellange en lange termijn.
Je bent back-up voor je directe collega's in geval van afwezigheid (opvolging FMB’s, projectopvolging, deelname aan vergaderingen en feedback aan collega’s).


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je bent in het bezit van een masterdiploma of gelijkwaardig door ervaring als Business & Data Analyst (minstens 3 jaar ervaring in de materie)
Je hebt een eerste relevante ervaring als Business & Data Analyst
Professionele ervaring binnen een verzekeringsinstelling (mutualiteit) of het domein gezondheidszorg is een plus.


Technische Competenties


Je kan vlot werken met de MS-Office toepassingen, voornamelijk met Word en Excel.
Je beheerst het Nederlands perfect, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling en je hebt een gevorderde kennis van het Frans (niveau B2).


Gedragscompetenties


Informatie analyseren: je bekijkt informatie vanuit een kritisch standpunt en aanvaardt informatie niet zonder er verder over na te denken.
Opvolging verzekeren: je volgt met een gepaste frequentie acties op en stuurt bij in functie van de te bereiken objectieven.
Oplossingen implementeren: je neemt het initiatief om oplossingen aan te reiken, ook in onbekende situaties. Je neemt concrete acties om problemen op te lossen en vooruit te gaan.
Continu leren: Je plant en beheert je eigen groei actief en stelt het eigen functioneren kritisch in vraag. Je verwerft continu nieuwe inzichten, vaardigheden en kennis.
Communiceren: je brengt een boodschap of gegevens op een duidelijke, correcte en transparante manier over, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling, in functie van het doel en het publiek.
Regels & procedures toepassen: Je werkt nauwkeurig en respecteert de procedures en regels.


HR Rail wil dat de sociale diversiteit weerspiegeld wordt in zijn medewerkers. Het zijn je talenten en enthousiasme die tellen, niet je geslacht, leeftijd, afkomst of handicap.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?


Een contractuele betrekking in een innovatief en dynamisch bedrijf.
Een interessante functie met de mogelijkheid om initiatieven en verantwoordelijkheden te nemen en waarin je de kans krijgt om jouw kennis en vaardigheden te ontwikkelen en uit te breiden.
Extra legale voordelen (hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques, enz.).
Variabele werkuren en na je opleiding mogelijkheid tot 3 dagen telewerk.
Een treinabonnement 1ste klas op het volledige Belgische netwerk.


Waar ga je werken?

HR Rail, een naamloze vennootschap van publiek recht, is de

HR-dienstverlener en juridische werkgever van alle medewerkers van de Belgische spoorwegen.

HR Rail is een samenwerkingsplek waar de klant altijd op de eerste plaats komt, waar we verantwoordelijkheid nemen en waar we bij elke procedure en elk project voortdurend de mogelijke efficiëntie verbeteren. Dit zijn onze waarden en ons DNA, onze CORE: samenwerking, klantgerichtheid, verantwoordelijkheid en efficiëntie.

Binnen HR Rail is de dienst Care4Rail verantwoordelijk voor het medisch-maatschappelijk beleid van de Belgische spoorwegen. Het omvat de Kas der geneeskundige verzorging (KGV), de verzekeringsinstelling van het statutaire personeel van de Belgische Spoorwegen, voor wat betreft de verplichte verzekering voor geneeskundige verzorging.

Het managementteam en het team voor project- en IT-management van de KGV zijn gevestigd in Brussel.

De regionale teams staan in voor het rechtstreeks contact met de aangeslotenen en zorgen voor de praktische uitvoering van de regelgeving rond geneeskundige verzorging, zoals het toekennen van rechten, terugbetalingen en toelatingen.

De facturatie en de contacten met zorgverleners worden centraal opgevolgd door een gespecialiseerd team in Brussel.

Jouw werkplek is gelegen vlakbij het station in Brussel (station Brussel-Zuid).

What’s next ?


Stel je kandidaat via deze link: https://jobs.infrabel.be/HRRail/job/BrusselBruxelles-Business-&-Data-Analyst-Healthcare/826262702/


De inschrijvingen worden gesloten zodra wij voldoende aantal kandidaturen hebben ontvangen.


Als je na screening van jouw cv en sollicitatiebrief voldoet aan het profiel dat wij zoeken, wordt je gevraagd niet-eliminerende redeneertesten af te leggen en een online persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst in te vullen.


HR Rail behoudt zich het recht voor het aantal sollicitanten te beperken tot de profielen die het best bij de functiebeschrijving passen.


Vervolgens word je uitgenodigd voor een online interview waarin jouw belangstelling voor de functie en jouw vaardigheden en ervaring nader worden beoordeeld. Dit selectiegesprek wordt voorafgegaan door een case-study.
Als jij de kandidaat bent die wij zoeken, moet je ons nog enkele documenten bezorgen (je diploma, strafblad, ...).
Klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 51223

Over Het Selectieproces

Kristien Van Wichelen

02/525 45 62

kristien.vanwichelen@hr-rail.be

Over De Inhoud Van De Job

02/525 25 74

inge.vandekerckhove@hr-rail.be

Of

02/525 48 54

Title: Data Analyst Forensic Investigations
Description:
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us
Do you want to sharpen your profile in the field of Financial Advisory – Forensic and broaden your horizons in interdisciplinary projects? Our team ensures the investigation and prevention of financial and white-collar crime across all industries. Secure our joint success and make a difference with us: as a Experienced Consultant Data Analyst Forensic.
Locations: Brussels, Belgium
Your impact:
As a Experienced Consultant Forensic, you will support the reappraisal of financial and white-collar crime as well as their prevention - and thus contribute to the security and business viability of companies.
Investigation: You will support us in conducting special investigations in cases of economic and corporate crime.
Dispute and Litigation: To this end, you will prepare expert opinions on accounting law or business management issues for legal disputes, for example.
Fraud Prevention: You will be actively involved in the design and implementation of preventive measures as well as the improvement of internal processes and control systems.
Innovative approaches: In addition, you will develop solutions with us that take into account current and future customer needs and offer significant added value.
Teamwork: You will work with other Deloitte Practices in Belgium and abroad on an interdisciplinary basis and take on responsible tasks at an early stage.


Let's talk about you
Your skillset:
Degree  business engineer,  economics, business informatics or a comparable course of study successfully completed
Proficiency in advanced data analytics techniques and tools (e.g., statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning) with the ability to apply these skills to complex business problems.
Ideally, initial practical experience in the areas of forensic, compliance, audit, tax consulting, accounting or controlling
High self-motivation, Independence and enjoyment of complex issues and conceptual tasks
Strong team orientation, good presentation and communication skills
Willingness to travel as well as very good written and spoken Dutch and English

Your chance:

Best-in-class continuing education at Deloitte University as well as within the framework of individual qualification offers and training courses
Comprehensive development opportunities through structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation as well as promotion of social commitment and corporate volunteering
Work-life balance thanks to mobile working & part-time, sabbaticals and family services, e.g. to support family caregivers, parental leave counselling and much more
Focus on health and fitness through regular health days, cooperation with fitness providers and support for sports and team events
Attractive employer benefits including bike and car leasing, company smartphone for private use and flexible working models such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working
Diverse creative freedom and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture - including through our Diversity & Inclusion employee networks
Our Risk, Regulatory & Forensic practice is a global leader in helping clients manage risk and uncertainty from the boardroom to the network. We provide a broad array of services that allow our clients around the world to better measure, manage and control risk to enhance the reliability of systems and processes throughout their organization.



Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:



My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities


Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte


Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte


Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte


Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities




Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:



Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).


Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.




Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
Show more

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst-Developer
Description:
Within our department IT Front & Packages with the mission of developing and maintaining our web applications and all our third-party applications, we are seeking a Data Analyst-Developer. The person will play a central role in developing IT Data & BI solutions to reach business objectives. She/He will ensure the availability, performance, and evolution of key business applications that support operational and strategic needs. She/He will strive to maximize the use of the company’s data assets.

The team consists of 8 colleagues who are eager to welcome you!

Your responsibilities

As An Analyst-Developer, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
Designing, developing, and implementing data warehousing and BI solutions to meet business requirements.
Performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as SQL, Python, and ETL frameworks.
Developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Power BI.
Ensuring data integrity, quality, and security across all data platforms.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Supporting the business in understanding and using the available data to facilitate creation of their own reports and dashboards Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in data analytics, BI & AI.
Participating in data & BI documentation (implement and manage tools supporting the documentation and contribute to the content along with other team members).
Implementing and managing tools that will improve data security and governance.


Your profile


You hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, a related field, or possess equivalent experience.
You have proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Developer, or similar role.
You have proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and database management.
You have experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
You are familiar with programming languages such as Python.
You are fluent in English and French or Dutch, with a good command of the other national language.
You can learn quickly and adapt in a dynamic environment.
You have an analytical mindset and are solution-oriented.
You are proactive and can communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
You value teamwork and can work both on-site and remotely, including with offshore developers.


Good reasons to join us


A permanent employment contract.
A company that values human scale within a dynamic group where you can make a significant impact.
Accessible management that is close to its employees and fosters a pleasant working environment.
Numerous development opportunities, particularly through our Athora Academy.
A balance between professional and private life with generous holidays (at least 39 days a year), flexible working hours, and up to 3 days of teleworking per week.
An attractive salary package with various fringe benefits.
Modern, bright offices that encourage collaboration.
A central location in the Porte de Namur district, easily accessible by train and public transport, with parking available if needed.
Last but not least… a sunny terrace, after-work gatherings, team-building activities, an annual staff day, and many other events to discover… 😉


If you are looking for a friendly organization with a human touch and value collaboration and mutual support, you have come to the right place!

Apply By

31-07-2025


Show more
HTML:
Within our department IT Front & Packages with the mission of developing and maintaining our web applications and all our third-party applications, we are seeking a Data Analyst-Developer. The person will play a central role in developing IT Data & BI solutions to reach business objectives. She/He will ensure the availability, performance, and evolution of key business applications that support operational and strategic needs. She/He will strive to maximize the use of the company’s data assets.

The team consists of 8 colleagues who are eager to welcome you!

Your responsibilities

As An Analyst-Developer, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include

  • Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
  • Designing, developing, and implementing data warehousing and BI solutions to meet business requirements.
  • Performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as SQL, Python, and ETL frameworks.
  • Developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Power BI.
  • Ensuring data integrity, quality, and security across all data platforms.
  • Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
  • Supporting the business in understanding and using the available data to facilitate creation of their own reports and dashboards Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in data analytics, BI & AI.
  • Participating in data & BI documentation (implement and manage tools supporting the documentation and contribute to the content along with other team members).
  • Implementing and managing tools that will improve data security and governance.

Your profile

  • You hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, a related field, or possess equivalent experience.
  • You have proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Developer, or similar role.
  • You have proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and database management.
  • You have experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
  • You are familiar with programming languages such as Python.
  • You are fluent in English and French or Dutch, with a good command of the other national language.
  • You can learn quickly and adapt in a dynamic environment.
  • You have an analytical mindset and are solution-oriented.
  • You are proactive and can communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
  • You value teamwork and can work both on-site and remotely, including with offshore developers.

Good reasons to join us

  • A permanent employment contract.
  • A company that values human scale within a dynamic group where you can make a significant impact.
  • Accessible management that is close to its employees and fosters a pleasant working environment.
  • Numerous development opportunities, particularly through our Athora Academy.
  • A balance between professional and private life with generous holidays (at least 39 days a year), flexible working hours, and up to 3 days of teleworking per week.
  • An attractive salary package with various fringe benefits.
  • Modern, bright offices that encourage collaboration.
  • A central location in the Porte de Namur district, easily accessible by train and public transport, with parking available if needed.
  • Last but not least… a sunny terrace, after-work gatherings, team-building activities, an annual staff day, and many other events to discover… 😉

If you are looking for a friendly organization with a human touch and value collaboration and mutual support, you have come to the right place!

Apply By

31-07-2025

Title: Business Data Analyst Medior
Description:
Tu es motivé-e à t’engager dans la transition énergétique par des actions concrètes au cœur des systèmes d’information des acteurs du monde de l’énergie ? Ceci est probablement une opportunité pour toi.




Basée à Wavre, Ingestic est une entreprise de consultance IT à taille humaine active dans le secteur de l’énergie en Belgique où nous disposons d’une expertise reconnue.

Un marché en pleine croissance et en pleine évolution qui offre de multiples opportunités et de nombreux défis à relever !




Le sens de nos activités peut se résumer comme suit : “ Help the business to make the best use of information systems within the organization to get value from your data ”.




Notre équipe est composée de Business Analysts et de profils plus orientés Data qui travaillent en étroite collaboration auprès de nos clients (essentiellement les GRD belges, les transporteurs et les fournisseurs d’énergie).




Tu as déjà acquis et développé des compétences par des expériences professionnelles en tant que Business et Data Analyst et tu es à la recherche d’un nouveau défi au sein d’une équipe jeune et motivée ?




Voici notre proposition :




Ton job 📝




En tant que Business Data Analyst Ingestic, tu te positionnes à la fois comme expert-e du domaine de l'Énergie, sachant faire le lien entre les équipes business et IT de l’entreprise cliente, et d'autre part comme expert-e en analyse des données. En comprenant leurs modes de fonctionnement, tu traduis leurs besoins en actions concrètes.




Consultant polyvalent, tes responsabilités gravitent autour des tâches suivantes :




✓Tu soutiens le métier dans la conception de nouveaux produits ou dans l’évolution de produits existants.

✓Tu identifies et analyses les attentes du métier, tu modélises les processus opérationnels conduisant à la conception ou à l’évolution des outils informatiques, tu modélises les données liées au processus à mettre en œuvre.




Sur la base des besoins métier :

✓Tu rédiges les spécifications décrivant les exigences système détaillées de la solution.

✓Tu valides l’analyse fonctionnelle fournie par le département informatique afin de vérifier que la solution proposée répond parfaitement aux spécifications.

✓Tu soutiens le business dans la spécification et l’exécution des tests de validation du logiciel.

✓Tu formes et tu aides le business à utiliser les outils de manière optimale.




D'un point de vue Data :

✓Tu es en charge des analyses de données poussées à l'aide de technologies et d'outils ad hoc ✓Tu exploites les données du client pour lui fournir des insights pertinents

✓Tu alimentes tes analyses de graphiques et/ou dashboard pertinents et amènes une réelle valeur ajoutée "data driven"

✓Tu adaptes ton discours technique face à un auditoire business pour vulgariser tes conclusions.




Ton profil 🤓

✓Titulaire d’un Master orienté Data (Ingénieur-e civil-e, ingénieur-e industriel-le, ingénieur-e de gestion, sciences économique et de gestion, …) ou expérience professionnelle dans un poste orienté Data d'au moins 2 ans.

✓Niveaux demandés en langue :

Français (C2/parfaite maîtrise)

Anglais (B2/ avancé)

(B2/avancé)

✓Tu as d’excellentes compétences analytiques et conceptuelles.

✓Tu travailles de manière autonome et efficace et tu es orienté-e solutions.

✓Tu as une très bonne communication orale et écrite.

✓Tu es à l’écoute de tes interlocuteurs afin d’obtenir une compréhension précise des besoins du client.

✓Tu as l’esprit d’équipe et le sens de l’initiative tout en gardant ton esprit critique

✓La connaissance du secteur énergétique belge et une expérience professionnelle dans ce secteur (idéalement auprès d’un GRD) sont de gros atouts.

✓Tu as des connaissances et une expérience sur des méthodologies de travail AGILE (SCRUM, KANBAN…)




Tu possèdes les compétences techniques suivantes :

✓Tu sais exploiter les données dans un environnement Cloud (Azure, AWS) via des services tels que DataFactory, Databricks, Data Lake ; Athena, Glue, …. Tu possèdes idéalement une certification attestant de cette connaissance.

✓Tu maîtrises une technologie de manipulation/visualisation de données, tel que Power BI, Tableau.

✓Tu maîtrises SQL.

✓Tu as déjà fait de la manipulation de données en Python (via notebooks) et/ou en R.

✓Tu maîtrises très bien Excel (exploitation des données, schématisation, tables pivot, macros…). ✓Tu as de l’expérience dans l’analyse de flux et la modélisation de processus (UML et BPMN).

✓Tu as une expérience avec des outils ETL (SSIS, SSAS, …).

✓Tu as une affinité avec la BI.




Notre offre 🎁

Tu rejoindras une entreprise jeune en plein développement qui t’offrira une formation continue et de nombreuses opportunités de progression.




Tu bénéficieras d’une grande flexibilité (télétravail / attention pas de travail en mode 'remote') pour te permettre de trouver un bon équilibre entre ta vie privée et professionnelle.




Nous t’offrons un package salarial attractif comprenant :

✓Un salaire à la hauteur de ton expérience et de tes compétences

✓Prime individuelle sur base de tes performances et prime sur objectif commun (CCT90) ✓Indemnité forfaitaire mensuelle de télétravail.

✓Plan cafétaria

✓Une voiture de société avec carte essence et carte mobilité Modalizy

✓Des chèques repas

✓Une assurance hospitalisation

✓Une assurance groupe




Intéressé-e ? Envoie-nous ta lettre de motivation ainsi que ton CV

Nnous prendrons contact avec toi dans les plus brefs délais.

Show more

Title: Technical Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Technical Analyst to support the ongoing development and maintenance of the CWM (Client Wealth Management) platform. This role is essential for driving technical evolution, resolving performance issues, and ensuring seamless communication between frontend and backend systems.

You will work closely with development teams and external partners to define technical requirements, guide implementation, and support testing activities. Conduct technical analyses for new features and platform improvements. Document clear and actionable instructions for development teams. Investigate and resolve performance issues and communication gaps between frontend and backend.

Support the development of new features, including replacing outdated modules (e.g., digital signing within investment flows). Perform unit testing and validate data flows using tools like Postman and SQL.

Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure alignment and smooth delivery.

Monitor and support daily operations of the CWM platform, including bug tracking and issue resolution. Participate in planning and roadmap creation for upcoming technical initiatives.

Requirements

The technical analyst must have experience with the following technologies - Java, Angular, SQL

very important: webservices (YAML, WSDL...)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department)
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won’t just sit in dashboards – it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we’re looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You’ll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact – all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:


translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems…)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios


What You Bring To The Table


5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English


Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow’s multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today’s three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:


a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)


Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers – 02 370 30 62 – erwin.verniers@external.equans.com – https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers
Show more

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Freelance Data Engineer
Description:
Location: Brussels - Hybrid (2 days remote/week after training)

Duration: Full-time, long-term contract

Tech Stack: Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Stream/Log Analytics, Azure DevOps, SQL Server, Python, Power BI, Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, Apache Arrow




About the Role

We’re seeking a talented Freelance Data Engineer to join a dynamic Data & Digital team, shaping a cutting-edge Data Platform that powers strategic business goals, innovation, and transformation. You’ll work in agile product teams to design and deliver data pipelines, storage structures, materialized views, and data exchange endpoints, while collaborating closely with business stakeholders to drive impactful solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

✔ Pipeline Development. Build and optimize data pipelines using Azure services (Databricks, Data Factory, Functions, Stream/Log Analytics) and Python in a Databricks environment.

✔ Data Architecture: Design efficient storage structures and materialized views for analytical technologies.

✔ Stakeholder Collaboration: Work with business analysts to refine requirements and present reusable, integrated solutions.

✔ Testing & DevOps: Contribute to extensive solution testing and reinforce DevOps practices within the team.

✔ Documentation: Create clear, structured documentation for data models, pipelines, and processes.

✔ Governance Support: Engage with data governance tools (Glossary, Modeling, Lineage, Data Quality) to ensure compliance and quality.

✔ Continuous Learning: Stay open to exploring new technologies like Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, or Apache Arrow.




Ideal Candidate Profile

✅ 3–5+ years of hands-on experience in **2 of the following**:

- SQL Server

- Azure services (Databricks, Data Factory, Functions, Stream/Log Analytics, DevOps)

- Python-based data pipelines/enrichments in Databricks

- Power BI reporting

✅ Openness to learning new technologies (e.g., Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, Apache Arrow).

✅ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on iterative, transversal data solutions.

✅ Customer-oriented, product-focused mindset with excellent communication skills.

✅ Team player who thrives in a collaborative, agile environment.

✅ Fluent in **English** (mandatory); proficiency in French, Dutch, or German is a plus.

✅ Experience in the energy sector is a bonus!

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Functional Data Analyst Consultant




Permanent contract




FR or NL + EN




Ever wondered what it feels like to be at the cutting edge of digital innovation? Our Digital Services team at Orange Business is a dynamic community of expert consultants revolutionizing Customer Experience, Cloud, Data, and AI across various sectors, including retail, finance, manufacturing, life sciences, and public services.




We have a significant international presence, with 20% of our activity extending beyond Belgium, and this number continues to grow. In this role, you will act as a key member of the dynamic Functional Data Architecture Consulting team (19 enthusiastic consultants). You’ll dive into exciting data and functional analysis missions across diverse and impactful projects.







Check out some of our ongoing projects:

Rebuilding the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Data Platform (CDP) systems in the aviation industry.
Refactoring the Fund Management application in a financial institution by modernizing data storage for improved efficiency and enhancing data visualization.
Data Management projects in retail, transport, and financial sectors.

If you want to take part in this exciting journey, please take a look at the following requirements and let’s meet up if they match your profile!







Your Key Areas of Responsibility as a Functional Data Analyst Consultant:

Driving Data Innovation through Data Modelling, Data Process Improvement, and Data Analysis.
Turning Data Management into practice.
Collecting business and technical requirements and performing gap analysis.
Building documentation and testing implementations of the innovative solutions.
Stakeholder management: Meeting and managing customer needs and expectations.
Forge trust and credibility by communicating with business users and IT stakeholders at different levels.







Who you are:

Your interest & soft skills

A good affinity with and interest in technological solutions, with the capability to communicate effectively with different stakeholders.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Effectively operate in workshop and interview contexts.
Autonomous and solutions oriented.
Dynamic team player.
Strong communication and presentation skills in French and/or Dutch + English.




Your technical experience

At least 4-5 years hands-on experience in Data & Functional analysis in the context of large-scale implementation projects.
Experience in the following domains: Functional analysis, design and testing, Data modelling (classical data modelling as well as star schema modelling), Data change management.
Experience in one or more of the following operational or analytical business areas: Marketing Automation & optimization, Digital and social Marketing, sales force automation, Marketing analysis, sales reporting, dashboarding, benchmarking, customer servicing dashboarding, general reporting & analysis, Data analytics & visualization, data quality, data analysis and data science, GDPR compliance.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.
Experience in tool implementation: CRM tools, BI reporting & analysis tools, Portal environments and tools, Data Governance (metadata, MDM, data quality).
Proficient reporting and documentation skills.
Fluency in SQL and other programming languages is highly desirable.










Why you should join us:

Some of the rewards of working at Orange Business

A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise. Continuously seeking new ideas, we proudly host regular “Guild” workshops and knowledge-sharing sessions through our Data Meetups.
Career growth possibilities.
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification.
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential.
Hybrid ways of working and modern & collaborative office in Brussels.
Compelling advantages including a yearly bonus scheme, a flexible mobility with possibility for a housing budget, representation and expense allowances…
Read more about the benefits we offer here.




Apply now

We can't wait to meet you!




More about Orange Business:

Check out our website for even more or connect with us on LinkedIn.

Show more

Title: Officer, Future Surveillance and Control systems
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

31-Aug-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

7,970.25

Grade

NATO Grade G17-G20


SUMMARY



The NATO Office of Resources (NOR) provides independent and integrated expert advice to the Secretary General, NATO Resource Committees, Allies, and other stakeholders on the planning, allocation and utilisation of military common funding made available to achieve NATO’s goals and objectives.

The NOR advice is based on sound judgement underpinned by facts, figures expertise and knowledge. It follows NATO policies, procedures and standards, and is independent of external stakeholder’s viewpoints. It supports efficient and effective use of public funds by assessing the policy compliance, eligibility, affordability, technical viability, and lifecycle implications of military requirements and proposed solutions. Furthermore, the NOR facilitates resource-informed political decision-making.

The NOR Air and Space Capabilities (ASC) Branch provides technical, financial, economic and political advice and support regarding implementation of NATO common-funded capabilities, in particular capital investments under the NATO Security Investment Programme (NSIP) and Operations & Maintenance (O&M) funded by the NATO Military Budget. The Branch ensures the delivery of Integrated Air and Missile Defense (IAMD), NATO-wide Air Command & Control (AirC2), Joint Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (JISR) including Indications & Warning (I&W), Surveillance and Control (including NATO Airborne Early Warning & Control and Alliance Future Surveillance and Control), as well as Space capabilities.

The incumbent is a member of the ASC Branch and responsible for the development of expert advice on future Surveillance and Control systems. Within an area of responsibility, they advise the resource committees, Strategic Commanders, NATO Agencies and NATO nations by:


evaluating military requirements and associated technical solutions presented in Capability Programme Plans and Project Proposals from an investment, running cost and workforce point of view;
evaluating and reporting on requests for authorisation to implement projects and budgets required for the operation and maintenance of the implemented systems;
monitoring project implementation and accepting completed investment projects;
contributing to the development of resource policy advice.



The incumbent may be required to replace the Branch Heador other Branch colleagues during their absence.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE



Essential

The incumbent must:


have a Master’s Degree or equivalent level of education in computer science, electronic engineering and/or very closely related science/engineering field, from an institute of a recognized standing ;
have 5 years of experience as system or project manager in the field of Surveillance and Control, either in procurement and implementation, or in the field of design, development and production, or in the field of operation and support through life-cycle;
be fully conversant and experienced with state-of-art principles and methodologies of programme and project management, including risk management;
demonstrate the ability to communicate both verbally and in writing complex technical and financial advice and support in a clear and understandable way to both expert and non-expert audiences;
demonstrate the ability to act with tact and diplomacy in a multinational environment where decision-making occurs by reaching consensus ;
demonstrate flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and working hours, when necessary;
possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one; II (“Elementary”) in the other ;



DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:


working experience in complex multinational environments where various interests are at stake;
knowledge of National funding or NATO’s common-funding processes and procedures;
knowledge and/or experience in the field of JISR, IAMD, AirC2, I&W or Space systems and principles;
proven qualification / certification in the fields of Programme management and/or Project management;
extensive knowledge of modern engineering techniques related to various subjects impacting military capabilities;
understanding and/or knowledge of NATO military concepts and principles;
the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and possess strong teamwork skills;
a higher level of the second NATO official language.
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES



Expertise Development

Provide expert advice to stakeholders in committees, national delegations and authorities of member Nations, NATO agencies, as well to military authorities at various levels on NATO capabilities and related resource issues. Conduct technical meetings with civilian and military staff of member nations considering projects and associated engineering required by the Strategic Commanders. Advise and collaborate with other engineers and programme coordinators engaged in defining cost-effective ways of meeting military requirements. Apply engineering skills, with a good understanding of NATO’s political environment and within the wider context of NATO’s common funded activities. Present, argue and defend the assessment on initial budget estimates, costing and technical solutions before the NATO resource committees, the NATO Military Authorities (NMAs) and the NATO Agencies .

Policy Development

Contribute to policy development on NATO military common-funded resources within own area of responsibility through the provision of expert technical advice as required. Determine the impact of existing policies and architectures on the design and implementation of NATO projects. Produce and present concise and comprehensive reports on the submitted military requirement, proposed technical solution, implementation plans and resource estimates, to the NATO resource and other committees.

Project Management

Prepare and present reports to the Resource Policy and Planning Board (RPPB) for capability programme planning approval, in their responsibility for projects and programmes. Prepare and present advice concerning project proposals and associated requests to the Investment Committee (IC) or the Budget Committee (BC) for services. Determine the direction of assigned projects/programs, identify risks and suggest possible solutions. Provide technical advice and liaison with NATO Military Authorities, NATO Agencies and host nations for NATO projects. Act as a Chairperson of Joint Final Inspection and Formal Acceptance Teams and prepare reports, which recommend acceptance. Liaise with the Strategic Commanders for the preparation and screening of initial budget estimates for the Operation and Maintenance of relevant systems. Prepare and present reports on budgetary issues related to these systems to the BC.

Financial Management

Review costed project proposals and initial budget estimates, screen the submissions and requests for funds for compliance with NATO policy. Monitor and report on the funding profiles and expenditures profiles of projects/systems or groups of projects/systems at all stages during their life cycle. Utilise the NATO Common Funded Integrated Resource Information System (CIRIS) or its successor.

Knowledge Management

Contribute to knowledge management through systems and processes with relevant technical and project/system management expertise on projects funded by NATO. Determine that the content of knowledge management systems is relevant and accessible to users.

Representation of the Organization

Contribute to NATO representation by developing and communicating information supportive of NATO’s interests. Act as a Chairperson of various technical meetings representing the NOR. Represent NATO as a technical expert and advisor during site visits and inspections as well as in other circumstances linked to the assessment, design or implementation of NATO funded projects and programmes. Conduct and lead meetings on NATO common-funded projects with authority, involving different stakeholders from NATO member nations, NATO Military Authorities and NATO Agencies, at different work and management levels.

Stakeholder Management

Determine how best to enhance and develop a network of key stakeholders. Assess, manage and consolidate the network within the broader interests of the NOR. Provide options for effective issue management through monitoring and analysis of current affairs. Proactively develop a network of stakeholders to ensure that the resource-impact of decisions is considered as early as possible. Assist, as directed, in the formulation of technical architectures and standards, which guide Alliance member nations and NMAs .

Perform any other related duty as assigned.


INTERRELATIONSHIPS



The incumbent reports to the Branch Head ASC and must be able to operate with diplomacy and tact in a multinational environment where decision-making occurs by reaching consensus among the NATO Member Nations and where various different, also national industrial, interests are at stake. The incumbent participates in, leads and advises during discussions with national Delegations and Authorities of member countries. They also liaise with appropriate NATO Agencies, NATO Military Authorities and national Authorities at Ministries of Defence and other members of the International Staff.

Direct reports: N/A

Indirect reports: N/A


COMPETENCIES



The incumbent must demonstrate:


Achievement: Creates own measures of excellence and improves performance;
Analytical Thinking: Sees multiple relationships;
Change Leadership: Expresses vision for change;
Impact and Influence: Uses indirect influence;
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation;
Organizational Awareness: Understands organizational politics;
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others.



6. CONTRACT

Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years; possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.

NOTE: Irrespective of previous qualifications and experience, candidates for twin-graded posts will be appointed at the lower grade. Advancement to the higher grade is not automatic, and will not normally take place during the first three years of service in the post.

Under specific circumstances, serving staff members may be appointed directly to the higher grade, and a period of three years might be reduced by up to twenty four months for external candidates. These circumstances are described in the IS directive on twin-graded posts.


USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS



Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:


For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment



Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

HTML:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

31-Aug-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

7,970.25

Grade

NATO Grade G17-G20

  • SUMMARY


The NATO Office of Resources (NOR) provides independent and integrated expert advice to the Secretary General, NATO Resource Committees, Allies, and other stakeholders on the planning, allocation and utilisation of military common funding made available to achieve NATO’s goals and objectives.

The NOR advice is based on sound judgement underpinned by facts, figures expertise and knowledge. It follows NATO policies, procedures and standards, and is independent of external stakeholder’s viewpoints. It supports efficient and effective use of public funds by assessing the policy compliance, eligibility, affordability, technical viability, and lifecycle implications of military requirements and proposed solutions. Furthermore, the NOR facilitates resource-informed political decision-making.

The NOR Air and Space Capabilities (ASC) Branch provides technical, financial, economic and political advice and support regarding implementation of NATO common-funded capabilities, in particular capital investments under the NATO Security Investment Programme (NSIP) and Operations & Maintenance (O&M) funded by the NATO Military Budget. The Branch ensures the delivery of Integrated Air and Missile Defense (IAMD), NATO-wide Air Command & Control (AirC2), Joint Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (JISR) including Indications & Warning (I&W), Surveillance and Control (including NATO Airborne Early Warning & Control and Alliance Future Surveillance and Control), as well as Space capabilities.

The incumbent is a member of the ASC Branch and responsible for the development of expert advice on future Surveillance and Control systems. Within an area of responsibility, they advise the resource committees, Strategic Commanders, NATO Agencies and NATO nations by:

  • evaluating military requirements and associated technical solutions presented in Capability Programme Plans and Project Proposals from an investment, running cost and workforce point of view;
  • evaluating and reporting on requests for authorisation to implement projects and budgets required for the operation and maintenance of the implemented systems;
  • monitoring project implementation and accepting completed investment projects;
  • contributing to the development of resource policy advice.


The incumbent may be required to replace the Branch Heador other Branch colleagues during their absence.

  • QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE


Essential

The incumbent must:

  • have a Master’s Degree or equivalent level of education in computer science, electronic engineering and/or very closely related science/engineering field, from an institute of a recognized standing ;
  • have 5 years of experience as system or project manager in the field of Surveillance and Control, either in procurement and implementation, or in the field of design, development and production, or in the field of operation and support through life-cycle;
  • be fully conversant and experienced with state-of-art principles and methodologies of programme and project management, including risk management;
  • demonstrate the ability to communicate both verbally and in writing complex technical and financial advice and support in a clear and understandable way to both expert and non-expert audiences;
  • demonstrate the ability to act with tact and diplomacy in a multinational environment where decision-making occurs by reaching consensus ;
  • demonstrate flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and working hours, when necessary;
  • possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one; II (“Elementary”) in the other ;


DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:

  • working experience in complex multinational environments where various interests are at stake;
  • knowledge of National funding or NATO’s common-funding processes and procedures;
  • knowledge and/or experience in the field of JISR, IAMD, AirC2, I&W or Space systems and principles;
  • proven qualification / certification in the fields of Programme management and/or Project management;
  • extensive knowledge of modern engineering techniques related to various subjects impacting military capabilities;
  • understanding and/or knowledge of NATO military concepts and principles;
  • the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and possess strong teamwork skills;
  • a higher level of the second NATO official language.
  • MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES


Expertise Development

Provide expert advice to stakeholders in committees, national delegations and authorities of member Nations, NATO agencies, as well to military authorities at various levels on NATO capabilities and related resource issues. Conduct technical meetings with civilian and military staff of member nations considering projects and associated engineering required by the Strategic Commanders. Advise and collaborate with other engineers and programme coordinators engaged in defining cost-effective ways of meeting military requirements. Apply engineering skills, with a good understanding of NATO’s political environment and within the wider context of NATO’s common funded activities. Present, argue and defend the assessment on initial budget estimates, costing and technical solutions before the NATO resource committees, the NATO Military Authorities (NMAs) and the NATO Agencies .

Policy Development

Contribute to policy development on NATO military common-funded resources within own area of responsibility through the provision of expert technical advice as required. Determine the impact of existing policies and architectures on the design and implementation of NATO projects. Produce and present concise and comprehensive reports on the submitted military requirement, proposed technical solution, implementation plans and resource estimates, to the NATO resource and other committees.

Project Management

Prepare and present reports to the Resource Policy and Planning Board (RPPB) for capability programme planning approval, in their responsibility for projects and programmes. Prepare and present advice concerning project proposals and associated requests to the Investment Committee (IC) or the Budget Committee (BC) for services. Determine the direction of assigned projects/programs, identify risks and suggest possible solutions. Provide technical advice and liaison with NATO Military Authorities, NATO Agencies and host nations for NATO projects. Act as a Chairperson of Joint Final Inspection and Formal Acceptance Teams and prepare reports, which recommend acceptance. Liaise with the Strategic Commanders for the preparation and screening of initial budget estimates for the Operation and Maintenance of relevant systems. Prepare and present reports on budgetary issues related to these systems to the BC.

Financial Management

Review costed project proposals and initial budget estimates, screen the submissions and requests for funds for compliance with NATO policy. Monitor and report on the funding profiles and expenditures profiles of projects/systems or groups of projects/systems at all stages during their life cycle. Utilise the NATO Common Funded Integrated Resource Information System (CIRIS) or its successor.

Knowledge Management

Contribute to knowledge management through systems and processes with relevant technical and project/system management expertise on projects funded by NATO. Determine that the content of knowledge management systems is relevant and accessible to users.

Representation of the Organization

Contribute to NATO representation by developing and communicating information supportive of NATO’s interests. Act as a Chairperson of various technical meetings representing the NOR. Represent NATO as a technical expert and advisor during site visits and inspections as well as in other circumstances linked to the assessment, design or implementation of NATO funded projects and programmes. Conduct and lead meetings on NATO common-funded projects with authority, involving different stakeholders from NATO member nations, NATO Military Authorities and NATO Agencies, at different work and management levels.

Stakeholder Management

Determine how best to enhance and develop a network of key stakeholders. Assess, manage and consolidate the network within the broader interests of the NOR. Provide options for effective issue management through monitoring and analysis of current affairs. Proactively develop a network of stakeholders to ensure that the resource-impact of decisions is considered as early as possible. Assist, as directed, in the formulation of technical architectures and standards, which guide Alliance member nations and NMAs .

Perform any other related duty as assigned.

The incumbent participates in, leads and advises during discussions with national Delegations and Authorities of member countries. They also liaise with appropriate NATO Agencies, NATO Military Authorities and national Authorities at Ministries of Defence and other members of the International Staff.

Title: Freelance BI Consultant
Description:
Are you an experienced Freelance BI Consultant who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




For our client in Brussels we are looking for a Freelance BI Consultant for a longterm project.




Analysis & Design: Translate business needs into technical specifications and design data architectures using tools like Open API and Azure. Comfortable designing technical architectures for data projects.




Development & Integration: Build secure, high-performance ETL pipelines with Azure Data Factory, connect heterogeneous data sources, and integrate systems using Python, MySQL, and GIT. Experience with Azure DevOps and automated data pipelines.




Delivery & Documentation: Deliver ready-to-use datasets for Power BI dashboards and KPIs. Document processes clearly using tools such as Confluence, SharePoint, or Notion.




Quality & Maintenance: Ensure data quality through testing, filtering, and profiling. Maintain and evolve BI, Datalake, and Data Warehouse platforms. Familiar with data quality concepts and production pipeline maintenance.




Continuous Improvement & Languages: Continuously refine processes and expand expertise in Business Intelligence. Languages: French (native/bilingual), English (full professional fluency), Dutch (nice to have). Experience in the public sector is a plus.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge, we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional.




Throughout the years we built long-lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.

We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result-driven, and do you have a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcoming you to the world of Brainbridge!
